title: Calories in a Buffalo Wing
meta_description: Discover calories in a buffalo wing, including protein, fat, carbs, sodium from sauce, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Bone-in chicken wing with skin, fried, coated in traditional buffalo hot sauce; average size (~42 g meat and skin).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wing size, frying method, sauce brand, and preparation; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A buffalo wing provides ~100 kcal, mostly from fat and sauce.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a buffalo wing?
faqs.a: About 100 kcal for one average fried buffalo wing with sauce.

faqs.q: What's the sodium in a buffalo wing?
faqs.a: Around 300 mg, mainly from the hot sauce.

faqs.q: Are buffalo wings high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, ~8 g fat per wing, including 2.2 g saturated from skin and frying.

faqs.q: How much protein in one buffalo wing?

faqs.a: Minimal, about 1 g carbs from the sauce; no fiber.
